Project meta data¶

File naming convention¶

Input files are monthly grids, defined by the variable and the statistic which was used to summarize the daily data to monthly.

Form: <variable code>_<monthly stat>_<flag><stat>_<period stat>_<period start>_<period end>.flt Example: TX_MAX_CMEAN_MAX_1946_1975.flt This denotes the maximum of the average monthly extreme maximim temperature for the period centred on 1960.

Filename parts <> Explanation
variable code Either a standard code (see here <link to table of our codes>) or a code supplied with the data
monthly stat The statistic describing the monthly climate variable
flag One of W or C. W denotes ‘weather’ whereas C denotes ‘climatology.’ This flag indicates whether the first statistic for the monthly is applied over the months of a year (weather) or over each month for the period (climatology). This is explained further in fig. 1 below.
stat The statistic which is applied in either the ‘W’ or ‘C’ direction.
period stat The statistic which is finnaly applied to summarize the data into a single grid.
period start The year which the period starts.
period end The year which the period ends (inclusive).

Figure 1: Calculating monthly statistics.

Variable codes¶

Code Label Description Units
TX Maximum temperature Maximum daily temperature C
TN Minimum temperature Minimum daily temperature C
TM Mean temperature Mean daily temperature ((TX-TN)/2) C
TR Temperature range Diurnal temperature range (|TX - TN|) C
PT Precipitation total Total daily precipitation mm
FD Frost day where TN < 0 (FD=1) integer
PD Rain day where precipitation < 1mm (PD=1) integer
SolarMJ Incident solar radiation Incident solar radiation J/m-s
WRel1 Relative soil moisture (upper) Upper horizon Fraction(0-1)
WRel2 Relative soil moisture (lower) Lower horizon Fraction(0-1)
FWPT Potential evaporation Potential evaporation m d-1

Statistic codes¶

Code Explanation
MAX Maximum
MIN Minimum
MEAN Mean
RNG Range (MAX-MIN)
TOT Total
PROP Proportion

Variable descriptions¶

Variable Description Units
TX_MAX_CMEAN_MAX_1946-1975 The maximum of the average monthly extreme maximum temperatures for the 30-year period centred on 1960 degrees Celsius
TN_MIN_CMEAN_MIN_1946-1975 The minimum of the average monthly extreme minimum temperatures for the 30-year period centred on 1960 degrees Celsius
FD_PROP_CMEAN_MAX_1946-1975 The maximum of the average monthly proportion of days when minimm temperatures were < 0 deg-C for the 30-year period centred on 1960 days
PD_PROP_CMEAN_MAX_1946-1975 The maximum of the average monthly proportion of days when precipitation > 1mm for the 30-year period centred on 1960 days
PT_MAX_CMEAN_MAX_1946_1975 The maximum of the average monthly extreme precipitation for the 30-year period centred on 1960 mm
